originalText.text: Not a responsible home health agency, they couldn't help us get essential medical wound care supplies after being with them for a whole month (person who is leaking bile needed changing wounds 3 times a day). Very poor head nursing assessments, the rehabilitation therapy which she needed the most only showed up twice a week for a lousy hour and sometimes didn’t show up at all, he promised to get us a bathing chair and failed as anticipated. It seems that these traveling caretakers have it good getting payed for not doing much to help with the needs of the patients. 2 stars and not 1 because after complaining to the management about medical supplies they made a special order to send them out (which they could have been doing throughout the month). They also cut off the aides two days before discharge which is NOT a safe discharge transition!

originalText.text: I broke my ankle in October and went to Reb and were assigned to this Angency. For Occupational therapy,  I had Ivonne and for Physical therapy,  I had Boaz briefly and than Komal. I must say that services given/received in any field,  has a lot to do with how us as a patient react to it. If we understand our treatment and their responsibilities of giving us said treatment, then we should receive a pleasant experience. I have a chronic illness and many other physical problems with chronic pain. I deal with a lot. It's frustrating. I get depressed. And with a broken ankle, it challenged and fueled my anxiety and depression but I expressed this to my therapists and they showed me empathy. I would recommend this agency. I have 20 plus years of health issues so I know how to recognize great service. To others who are struggling,  keep in mind that the Therapists deal with a lot and there just human. There in this field to help people. We need to also have good bedside manners and keep in mind, it's not their fault we need therapy. Hang in there and let's all be kind to one another. And thank you guys for working through COVID-19 and taking a risk. Stay safe everyone!

originalText.text:
The rehab team is extremely helpful when answering questions and always go the extra mile.

They try to make the transition to outpatient as seamless as possible and I’m very appreciative of their efforts. Aly was especially kind and helpful in the process.

They are excellent.

originalText.text: I  would give a zero if I could.  No one showed up to my mother's house.  The coordinator called and said that the aide had an emergency and that she is looking for someone and will call back later with a name.  She never called back after 4 hours.  When I called the office, I was told to hold on (for almost half an hour) then someone came on said goodbye and hung up.  When I called back and told the operator who answered the phone what happened, she said that did not happen.  I asked to talk to someone else who came on the phone chewing in my ear, and she told me the coordinator called back and told me that she does not have someone for the day, which the coordinator did not, I immediately got irritated and upset, so I  let her have it upon which she hung up on me.  I only started with this agency July 1st and would recommend no one to them.

originalText.text: Therapy provided is excellent! I have been working here for about 8 months and I can say that everyone really tries their best to provide the best care possible. Kind and compassionate staff.
